newsitem.title: USA: Pena to leave as Transportation Secretary.
newsitem.headline: Pena to leave as Transportation Secretary.

text.p: U.S. Transportation Secretary Federico Pena has given President Bill Clinton his resignation, department sources said on Thursday.
The department had no official comment and a spokesman said: "Secretary Pena has reached no final decision about his future."

Pena had drawn fire for a statement made in May after the crash of a ValuJet airliner near Miami that Valujet was a safe airline. U.S. authorities later grounded ValuJet for safety shortcomings, although it has since resumed flying.
Department officials noted that during Pena's nearly four-year tenure he approved regulations to take the safety levels of small commuter aircraft up to those of big airliners.
In addition, they said, he signed 40 aviation agreements to reduce restrictions on international air travel.
The officials said that during Pena's time in office, U.S. investment in transportation infrastructure increased by 22 percent over the previous four-year period.
